Package sailpoint.integration

Class AuthenticationUtil

  • java.lang.Object

extends java.lang.Object
    A utility to help perform authentication for REST requests.

      • PARAM_AUTHN_USER

        public static final java.lang.String PARAM_AUTHN_USER
        Argument that can be used to specify username for authentication. Consulted if an "Authorization" header is not found. This is assumed to be in clear text.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getCredentials

        public static java.lang.String[] getCredentials​(java.lang.String authHeader,
                                                java.lang.String authnUserParam,
                                                java.lang.String authnPasswordParam)
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Return the credentials pulled from the request in a two-element String array with the first element being the username and the second element being the password. These are pulled from the given Authorization header if present, or special request parameters. This will support Basic and Bearer tokens.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • decodeHeader

        public static java.lang.String[] decodeHeader​(java.lang.String authHeader)
        Process an authorization header that may or may not have an encoded header value. The possible formats of authHeader will include Basic, Bearer with header values that may be encoded. The assumption is, if a Basic header, the separator will be ":". If a Bearer header, the separator will be ".". For security reasons, the header value should always be encoded. Only Basic and Bearer are supported. The header value parts are returned. Examples: Basic c3BhZG1pbjphZG1pbg== Basic user:password Bearer Q2Fyb2wuQWRhbXMuazNrM2RkM2pkZGQ5M2tkPT0zMGtkazNpa2RrZGkzbGFzbA== Bearer user.token
        Parameters:
        authHeader - the header to act on
        Returns:
        String['part1','part2'] or 'user','pass' for Basic auth; 'clientId', 'token' for Bearer. May return null.

      • isBasicAuth

        public static boolean isBasicAuth​(java.lang.String authHeader)
        If the Authorization header doesn't start with "Basic", then this is not basic authorization. Invalid authentication header formats will return false. Valid format: Basic
        Parameters:
        authHeader - -
        Returns:
        true if "Basic " is at the beginning of the provided string

      • isBearerAuth

        public static boolean isBearerAuth​(java.lang.String authHeader)
        If the Authorization header doesn't start with "Bearer", then this is not bearer authorization. Invalid authentication header formats will return false. Valid format: Bearer
        Parameters:
        authHeader - -
        Returns:
        true if "Bearer " is at the beginning of the provided string

      • getBearerTokenValue

        public static java.lang.String getBearerTokenValue​(java.lang.String authHeader)
        Extract the Bearer token from the Authentication header (Authentication Bearer xxxxxx).
        Parameters:
        authHeader - - Authentication header value
        Returns:
        String - value from Bearer authentication header

      • decodeToken

        public static com.auth0.jwt.interfaces.DecodedJWT decodeToken​(java.lang.String token)
        Decodes and possibly logs the JWT value.
        Parameters:
        token - - JWT string
        Returns:
        DecodedJWT - an object representing the decoded JWT

      • splitAuthHeader

        public static java.lang.String[] splitAuthHeader​(java.lang.String authHeader)
        Split an authorization header into its two parts: where type could be 'Basic', 'Bearer', or other. The expectation is the type and value are separated by a space. A null array will be returned if the param is null or the authHeader has no space. The type of the header is not validated here. Examples: Basic user:pw Basic user:this is my password Bearer Carol.Adams.xkdikeickesosodoo34394idkd Bearer spadmin.i3kdiilwl90w4fkf949ifif Bogus some string
        Parameters:
        authHeader - - complete authorization header which includes method and value separated by space
        Returns:
        String[] - first entry is the method and the second is the value or null if invalid header value

      • splitAuthHeaderValue

        public static java.lang.String[] splitAuthHeaderValue​(java.lang.String authHeaderValue,
                                                      java.lang.String separator)
        Splits an authorization header value by the separator. Since the first part could have the separator as part of the value, search backwards to get the last occurrence of the separator. This means the separator cannot be a valid character of the last part. Return null if the value format is incorrect or missing. If not separator is provided, the colon will be used. The authorization header value could be encrypted. If so, decrypted for splitting.
        Parameters:
        authHeaderValue - - value string from the authorization header (Basic or Bearer) and may be encrypted
        separator - - value that separates the two value parts (user:pw or clientId.token)
        Returns:
        String[] - position 0 contains the left part and position contains the right part. May be null.

      • validateJwt

        public static AuthenticationUtil.ValidationContext validateJwt​(com.auth0.jwt.interfaces.DecodedJWT jwt,
                                                               SailPointContext ctx)

      • validateJwt

        public static AuthenticationUtil.ValidationContext validateJwt​(com.auth0.jwt.interfaces.DecodedJWT jwt,
                                                               SailPointContext ctx,
                                                               boolean shortCircuit)
        Perform all validation on a decoded JWT. Short circuit can be turned on for efficiency. This is not tied directly to the Teams integration feature. It's intended to be a generic way to get a user-specific API access token. Configuration properties used. The 'require*' flags will determine if the properties are required. - scope: permission assigned to the Teams app, e.g. GetToken - correlationVariable: SSO token claim to use for IIQ identity/AD correlation. Must be a claim property, e.g. oid - audienceSuffix: string appended to the end of the Teams app URI, e.g. /iiq/api --> api://somehost.com/iiq/api - issuers: valid issuers (space separated) of the SSO token - may have variables where the variable is a claim property, e.g."https://sts.windows.net/{{tid}}/ https://login.microsoftonline.com/{{tid}}/v2.0" - audienceClaimValidationRequired - requires audience validation if true, defaults to false - issuersClaimValidationRequired - requires issuers validation if true, defaults to false - scopeClaimValidationRequired - requires scope validation if true, defaults to false
        Parameters:
        jwt - - decode JWT token
        ctx - - SailPoint database context
        shortCircuit - - true if the validation is to abort after any error; false to validate all
        Returns:
        ValidationContext - object that contains any errors and the validated user

      • getSeparator

        public static java.lang.String getSeparator​(java.lang.String authType)
        Determine the header value separator. If a Bearer token, the expected separator is a period. If a Basic token, the expected separator is a colon. This method will default to a colon, i.e. if the authType is not Bearer, a colon will be returned.
        Parameters:
        authType - - type of authorization header. Should be Bearer or Basic.
        Returns:
        String - separator based on authorization type; Bearer will return period. Anything else returns colon
